de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.pcmconnection

Class PcmRepositoryExtractor

  • public class PcmRepositoryExtractor
extends java.lang.Object
    Extracting a given Pcm repository. Offering 2 methods: getBlackboardForAllElements(RepositoryImpl) and getBlackboardForIds(RepositoryImpl, Collection)

    • Method Detail

      • getBlackboardForAllElements

        public Blackboard getBlackboardForAllElements(org.palladiosimulator.pcm.repository.impl.RepositoryImpl repository)
        Builds a new blackboard and writes the Beagle objects representing all found PCM elements to it. Only PCM elements that fulfil the restrictions described in the class description will be written.
        Parameters:
        repository - The repository to look up.
        Returns:
        A new blackboard having all translated PCM elements written on it. Will never be null.

      • getBlackboardForIds

        public Blackboard getBlackboardForIds(org.palladiosimulator.pcm.repository.impl.RepositoryImpl repository,
                                      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> identifiers)
        Builds a new blackboard and writes the Beagle objects representing PCM elements related to ids to it. Only PCM elements that fulfil the restrictions described in the class description will be written.

        For any provided ID id, PCM elements will be selected to be written on the blackboard as follows:

        • If id describes a component, all PCM elements that are part of the component’s service effect specification will be selected. Nested components will be inspected recursively.
        • If id describes a repository, all contained components will be inspected as if their ID had been provided.
        • If id describes a PCM element, it will be selected.
        • Any other ID will be silently ignored.
        Parameters:
        repository - The repository to look up.
        identifiers - Identifiers of elements in the repository files that shall be written to the Blackboard.
        Returns:
        A new blackboard having all selected and translated PCM elements written on it. Will never be null.
